text: my name is Kate Milwaukee I'm the head
of Donna relations at Karen open higher
education UNHCR has reported that less
than one percent of refugees globally
have access to education and we noticed
with the flux of people coming to
Germany that people face a lot of
challenges when trying to access
education challenges related to language
as well as documentation as well as
financial and with that comes a whole
host of mental health issues so we felt
that that was unfair and we decided to
start Karen to provide open higher
education to refugees primarily in
Germany but now as we've grown we're
actually providing online education to
refugees around the world we have an
entirely digital product and therefore
we need to ensure that our platform
remains interactive and cloud technology
makes that possible to date we have
supported 6,000 learners on our digital
platform and we have 90 stars across our
four offices our headquarters are in
Berlin we also have offices in Munich in
Amman and Beirut at Chiron we use a
number of AWS services which include
cloud watch cloud trail the API gateway
as well as ElastiCache and the AWS also
supports a number of our internal
organizational applications that relate
to ERP project management and also a
number of operations software so AWS has
really allowed us to be more flexible in
what we do and really provide customized
solutions for our learners we only have
one person responsible for DevOps so as
a small NGO we really benefit from AWS
security updates which save as time and
also the cost of to full-time staff
members as we grow our global brand we
naturally wanted to work with the market
leader another motivation for us was the
support AWS provides to NGOs and
startups AWS has allowed us to really
scale what we do and provide a
customized solution to our learners it's
allowed us to be more flexible in terms
of our applications and it's really
allowed us to provide a very individual
pathway for our students not only during
the point of study
also in terms of their future prospects
